<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="CondensedConsolidatedStatementsOf_202802"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Condensed Consolidated
Statements of Earnings</font></p>

 <tr>

 <tr>
  <td width="24%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:24.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.0pt;">Currency translation
  adjustments</font></p>
  </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
comprehensive earnings were $671 million and $826 million, respectively, for
the quarters ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004 and $2,049 million for the
first nine months of 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="CondensedConsolidatedStatementsOf_202924"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Condensed Consolidated
Statements of Cash Flows</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(in millions of dollars)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="26%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:26.5%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">For the Nine Months Ended</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">

 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash effects of changes, net of the effects from

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Decrease</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(47</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(312</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">

  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">

  </td>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="NotesToCondensedConsolidatedFinan_202934"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
1.&#160; Accounting Policies:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Basis of
Presentation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The interim condensed
consolidated financial statements of Kraft Foods Inc. (&#147;Kraft&#148;), together with
its subsidiaries (collectively referred to as the &#147;Company&#148;), are unaudited.&#160; It is the opinion of the Company&#146;s management
that all adjustments necessary for a fair statement of the interim results
presented have been reflected therein.&#160;
All such adjustments were of a normal recurring nature.&#160; Net revenues and net earnings for any interim
period are not necessarily indicative of results that may be expected for the
entire year.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">These statements should
be read in conjunction with the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements and
related notes, which are included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
June&nbsp;2005, the Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery
business for approximately $1.4 billion.&#160;
The Company has reflected the results of its sugar confectionery
business prior to the closing date as discontinued operations on the condensed
consolidated statements of earnings.&#160; The
assets related to the sugar confectionery business were reflected as assets of
discontinued operations held for sale on the consolidated balance sheet at December&nbsp;31,
2004.&#160; Accordingly, historical statements
of earnings amounts included in the notes to the condensed consolidated
financial statements have been restated to reflect the discontinued operation.&#160; The Company recorded a loss on sale of
discontinued operations of $297 million in the second quarter of 2005, related
largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the fourth quarter
of 2004, following the announcement of the sale of its sugar confectionery
business, the Company realigned its North American segments.&#160; The Company&#146;s new segments, which are
reflected in these condensed consolidated financial statements and notes, are
U.S. Beverages; U.S. Cheese, Canada&nbsp;&amp; North America Foodservice; U.S.
Convenient Meals; U.S. Grocery; U.S. Snacks&nbsp;&amp; Cereals; Europe, Middle
East&nbsp;&amp; Africa; and Latin America&nbsp;&amp; Asia Pacific.&#160; The new segment structure in North America
reflects a shift of certain divisions and brands between segments to more
closely align these businesses to consumer sectors, to provide more focus on
the separate beverage and grocery businesses, and to benefit from synergies in
grain based products.&#160; Historical data
have been restated to reflect the new segment structure.&#160; In addition, in October&nbsp;2005, the
Company announced that, effective January&nbsp;1, 2006, its Canadian business
will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American
business by product category.&#160;
Accordingly, in 2006 its operations will be reported throughout the
North American food segments and prior period segment amounts will be restated.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock-Based Compensation Expense</font></i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for
employee stock compensation plans in accordance with the intrinsic value-based
method permitted by </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;)</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> No.&nbsp;123, &#147;Accounting for
Stock-Based Compensation,&#148; which has not resulted in compensation cost for
stock options.&#160; The market value at date
of grant of restricted stock and rights to receive shares of stock is recorded
as compensation expense over the period of restriction (three years).</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the first quarter of 2005 and 2004, the Company granted shares of restricted
stock and rights to receive shares of stock to eligible employees, giving them
in most instances all of the rights of shareholders, except that they may not
sell, assign, pledge or otherwise encumber such shares and rights.&#160; Such shares and rights are subject to
forfeiture if certain employment conditions are not met.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the first quarter of 2005, the Company granted approximately 4.1 million
restricted Class&nbsp;A shares to eligible U.S.-based employees and also issued
to eligible non-U.S. employees rights to receive approximately</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:11.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\kyang\05-18510-1\task646208\18510-1-ba-01.htm',USER='Kyangb',CD='Nov  7 19:43 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.8
million Class&nbsp;A equivalent shares.&#160;
The market value of the shares and rights granted to the Company&#146;s
employees was approximately $196 million, or $33.32 per restricted share or
right, on the date of grant.&#160;
Restrictions on the stock and rights lapse in the first quarter of 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
fair value of the shares of restricted stock and rights to receive shares of
stock at the date of grant is amortized to expense ratably over the restriction
period.&#160; The Company recorded
compensation expense related to the restricted stock and rights of $112 million
and $36 million, respectively, for the nine months and three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, and $79 million and $27 million, respectively, for the nine months and
three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004.&#160;
The unamortized portion, which is reported on the condensed consolidated
balance sheets as a reduction of earnings reinvested in the business, was $243
million at September&nbsp;30, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition to restricted stock, at September&nbsp;30, 2005, the Company had
stock-based employee compensation plans that permit the issuance of stock
options to employees. The Company applies the recognition and measurement
principles of Accounting Principles Board Opinion No.&nbsp;25, &#147;Accounting for
Stock Issued to Employees,&#148; and related Interpretations in accounting for stock
options within those plans.&#160; No
compensation expense for employee stock options is reflected in net earnings,
as all stock options granted under those plans had an exercise price equal to
the market value of the common stock on the date of grant.&#160; The following table illustrates the effect on
net earnings and earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;) if the Company had applied the fair
value recognition provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;123 to measure stock-based
compensation expense for outstanding stock option awards (using a modified
Black-Scholes methodology) for the nine months and three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="85%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.5in;width:85.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.2%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:30.62%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">For the Nine Months Ended<br>
  September&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.2%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.42%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.19</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2004, the Financial
Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued SFAS No.&nbsp;123 (revised 2004), &#147;Share-Based
Payment&#148; (&#147;SFAS No.&nbsp;123R&#148;).&#160; SFAS No.&nbsp;123R
requires companies to measure compensation cost for share-based payments at
fair value.&#160; The Company will adopt this
new standard prospectively, on January&nbsp;1, 2006, and does not expect the
adoption of SFAS No.&nbsp;123R to have a material impact on its consolidated
financial position, results of operations or cash flows.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
2.&#160; Asset Impairment, Exit and
Implementation Costs: </font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Program:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2004, the
Company announced a three-year restructuring program with the objectives of
leveraging the Company&#146;s global scale, realigning and lowering its cost
structure, and optimizing capacity utilization.&#160;
As part of this program, the Company anticipates the closing or sale of
up to 20 plants and the elimination of approximately 6,000 positions.&#160; From 2004 through 2006, the Company expects
to incur approximately $1.2 billion in pre-tax charges, reflecting asset
disposals, severance and other implementation costs, including $814 million
incurred from January&nbsp;2004 through September&nbsp;30, 2005.&#160; Pre-tax restructuring program charges during
2005 are expected to be between $440 million and $470 million, including $173
million incurred in the first nine months of 2005.&#160; Approximately one-half of the pre-tax charges
are expected to require cash payments.&#160;
It is possible that the Company may undertake additional restructuring
programs in the future.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring
Costs:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the nine months
and three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, pre-tax charges under the
restructuring program of $112 million and $26 million, respectively, were
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statements of earnings.&#160; During the nine
months and three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, pre-tax charges under
the restructuring program of $452 million and $44 million, respectively, were
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statements of earnings.&#160; The pre-tax
charges for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 resulted from the
announcement of the closing of 3 plants, for a total of 16 since January&nbsp;2004,
and the continuation of a number of workforce reduction programs.&#160; Approximately $80 million of the pre-tax
charges incurred during the first nine months of 2005 will require cash
payments.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

(continued)</font></p>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="306" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="14" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="75" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="14" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="75" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="14" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="75" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="14" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="67" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="14" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Severance costs in the
above schedule, which relate to the workforce reduction programs, include the
cost of related benefits.&#160; Specific
programs announced during 2004 and the first nine months of 2005, as part of
the overall restructuring program, will result in the elimination of
approximately 4,600 positions.&#160; At September&nbsp;30,
2005, approximately 3,700 of these positions have been eliminated.&#160; In October&nbsp;2005, the Company announced
several simplification initiatives relating to its organizational
structure.&#160; These initiatives will result
in the elimination of approximately 600 additional positions, bringing the
total announcements to approximately 5,200 toward the program objective of approximately
6,000.&#160; Asset write-downs relate to the
impairment of assets caused by the plant closings and related activity.&#160; Other costs incurred relate primarily to
contract termination costs associated with the plant closings and the
termination of leasing agreements.&#160;
Severance charges taken against assets relate to incremental pension
costs, which reduce prepaid pension assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Implementation
Costs:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company recorded
pre-tax implementation costs associated with the restructuring program.&#160; These costs include the discontinuance of
certain product lines and incremental costs related to the integration and
streamlining of functions and closure of facilities.&#160; These costs were recorded on the condensed
consolidated statements of earnings as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.64%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.64%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.84%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Asset
Impairment Charges:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second quarter
of 2005, the Company sold its fruit snacks business for approximately $30
million.&#160; The Company incurred a pre-tax
asset impairment charge of $93 million in the first quarter of 2005 in
recognition of the sale of this business.&#160;
The charge, which includes the write-off of all intangible assets
associated with this business, was recorded as asset impairment and exit costs
on the condensed consolidated statement of earnings.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\kyang\05-18510-1\task646208\18510-1-ba-01.htm',USER='Kyangb',CD='Nov  7 19:43 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first quarter
of 2005, the Company completed its annual review of goodwill and intangible
assets and no charges resulted from this review.&#160; During the first quarter of 2004, the Company
recorded non-cash pre-tax charges of $29 million related to an intangible asset
impairment for a small confectionery business in the United States and certain
brands in Mexico.&#160; A portion of this
charge, $17 million, was reclassified to earnings from discontinued operations
on the consolidated statement of earnings in the fourth quarter of 2004.&#160; The remaining charge was recorded as asset
impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated statement of earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Total:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The pre-tax asset
impairment, exit and implementation costs discussed above, for the nine months
and three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, were included in the
operating companies income of the following segments:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.72%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">508</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\JMS\kyang\05-18510-1\task646208\18510-1-ba-01.htm',USER='Kyangb',CD='Nov  7 19:43 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
3.&#160; Related Party Transactions:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At September&nbsp;30,
2005, Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. owned 86.5% of the Company&#146;s outstanding shares
of capital stock.&#160; Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.&#146;s
subsidiary, Altria Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc., provides the Company with
various services, including planning, legal, treasury, accounting, auditing,
insurance, human resources, office of the secretary, corporate affairs,
information technology, aviation and tax services.&#160; Billings for these services, which were based
on the cost to Altria Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc. to provide such services
and a management fee, were $202 million and $230 million for the nine months
ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, respectively, and $64 million and $73
million for the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At September&nbsp;30,
2005, the Company had short-term amounts payable to Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. of
$524 million.&#160; Interest on intercompany
borrowings is based on the applicable London Interbank Offered Rate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
4.&#160; Acquisitions:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first nine
months of 2004, the Company acquired a U.S.-based beverage business for $136
million.&#160; The effect of this acquisition
was not material to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
operations or cash flows in any of the periods presented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
5.&#160; Divestitures:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Discontinued
Operations:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2005, the
Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business for
approximately $1.4 billion.&#160; The sale
included the <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Life Savers</font></i>, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Creme Savers</font></i>,
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Altoids</font></i>, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Trolli</font></i>
and <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Sugus</font></i> brands.&#160; The Company has reflected the results of its
sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as discontinued
operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings.&#160; Pursuant to the sugar confectionery sale
agreement, the Company has agreed to provide certain transition and supply
services to the buyer.&#160; These service
arrangements are primarily for terms of one year or less, with the exception of
one supply arrangement with a term of not more than three years.&#160; The expected cash flow from this supply
arrangement is not significant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Summary results of
operations for the sugar confectionery business were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

discontinued operations, above, for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, related largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

</font></div>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,458</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second quarter
of 2005, the Company sold its fruit snacks business.&#160; The Company incurred a pre-tax asset
impairment charge of $93 million in the first quarter of 2005 in recognition of
the sale of this business.&#160; During the
first quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts business, its U.S.
yogurt business and a minor trademark in Mexico.&#160; During the third quarter of 2004, the Company
sold a Brazilian snack nuts business.&#160;
The aggregate proceeds received from sales of these other businesses
during the first nine months of 2005 and 2004 were $218 million and $11
million, respectively.&#160; The Company
recorded pre-tax gains from sales of these other businesses of $115 million
during the first nine months of 2005, and recorded pre-tax losses from sales of
these other businesses of $8 million during the first nine months of 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The operating results of
the other businesses sold, discussed above, were not material to the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows in any of
the periods presented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
6.&#160; Earnings Per Share:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic and diluted EPS
from continuing and discontinued operations were calculated using the
following:</font></p>

  <td width="15%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.6%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,689</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.64%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,710</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Incremental shares from
assumed conversions are calculated as the number of shares that would be
issued, net of the number of shares that could be purchased in the marketplace
with the cash received upon stock option exercise or, in the case of restricted
stock and rights, the number of shares corresponding to the unamortized
compensation expense.&#160; For the nine
months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and the nine months and three months ended
September&nbsp;30, 2004, the number of stock options excluded from the
calculation of weighted average shares for diluted EPS because their effects
were antidilutive (i.e., the cash that would be received upon exercise is
greater than the average market price of the stock during the period) was
immaterial.&#160; For the three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, 15 million stock options were excluded from the calculation of weighted
average shares for diluted EPS because their effects were antidilutive.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
7.&#160; Contingencies:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft
and its subsidiaries are parties to a variety of legal proceedings arising out
of the normal course of business, including a few cases in which substantial
amounts of damages are sought.&#160; While the
results of litigation cannot be predicted with certainty, management believes
that the final outcome of these proceedings will not have a material adverse
effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of operations
or cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Third-Party Guarantees:</font></i>&#160; At September&nbsp;30,
2005, the Company&#146;s third-party guarantees, which are primarily derived from
acquisition and divestiture activities, approximated $25 million.&#160; Substantially all of these guarantees expire
through 2013, with $9 million expiring through September&nbsp;30, 2006.&#160; The Company is required to perform under
these guarantees in the event that a third party fails to make contractual
payments or achieve performance measures.&#160;
The Company has a liability of $19 million on its condensed consolidated
balance sheet at September&nbsp;30, 2005, relating to these guarantees.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

Net:</font></u></b></p>

  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total goodwill</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

follows:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.44%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">51</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-amortizable
intangible assets consist substantially of brand names purchased through the
Nabisco acquisition.&#160; Amortizable
intangible assets consist primarily of certain trademark licenses and
non-compete agreements.&#160; Pre-tax
amortization expense for intangible assets was $9 million and $8 million for
the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, respectively, and $4
million and $2 million for the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and
2004, respectively.&#160; Amortization expense
for each of the next five years is currently estimated to be approximately $12
million or less.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The movement in goodwill
and gross carrying amount of intangible assets from December&nbsp;31, 2004, is
as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\JMS\kyang\05-18510-1\task646208\18510-1-ba-01.htm',USER='Kyangb',CD='Nov  7 19:43 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
9.&#160; Segment Reporting:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company manufactures
and markets packaged food products, consisting principally of beverages,
cheese, snacks, convenient meals and various packaged grocery products.&#160; Kraft manages and reports operating results
through two units, Kraft North America Commercial and Kraft International
Commercial.&#160; Reportable segments for
Kraft North America Commercial are organized and managed principally by product
category.&#160; Kraft International Commercial&#146;s
operations are organized and managed by geographic location.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the fourth quarter of 2004, following the announcement of the sale of its sugar
confectionery business, as discussed in Note 5. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Divestitures</font></i>,
the Company realigned its North American segments.&#160; </font>Kraft North America Commercial&#146;s new
segments are </font>U.S. Beverages; U.S.
Cheese, Canada&nbsp;&amp; North America Foodservice; U.S. Convenient Meals;
U.S. Grocery; and U.S. Snacks&nbsp;&amp; Cereals.&#160; Kraft International Commercial&#146;s segments are
Europe, Middle East&nbsp;&amp; Africa; and Latin America&nbsp;&amp; Asia
Pacific.&#160; The new segment structure in North America
reflects a shift of certain divisions and brands between segments to more
closely align these businesses to consumer sectors, to provide more focus on
the separate beverage and grocery businesses, and to benefit from synergies in
grain based products.&#160; Historical data
have been restated to reflect the new segment structure.&#160; In addition, in October&nbsp;2005, the
Company announced that, effective January&nbsp;1, 2006, its Canadian business
will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American
business by product category.&#160;
Accordingly, in 2006 its operations will be reported throughout the
North American food segments and prior period segment amounts will be restated.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s management
uses operating companies income, which is defined as operating income before
general corporate expenses and amortization of intangibles, to evaluate segment
performance and allocate resources.&#160;
Management believes it is appropriate to disclose this measure to help
investors analyze the business performance and trends of the various business
segments.&#160; Interest and other debt
expense, net, and provision for income taxes are centrally managed and,
accordingly, such items are not presented by segment since they are not
included in the measure of segment profitability reviewed by management.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Segment data were as
follows:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.7%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.64%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24,450</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.7%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.64%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23,384</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.34%;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in Note 2. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Asset Impairment, Exit and Implementation Costs</font></i>, the Company
recorded asset impairment, exit and implementation costs of $266 million and
$42 million, respectively, during the nine months and three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, and $481 million and $51 million, respectively, during the nine months
and three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004.&#160;
See Note 2 for a breakdown of these pre-tax charges by segment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second quarter
of 2005, the Company sold its fruit snacks business and recorded a pre-tax loss
of $2 million.&#160; This loss is included in
the operating companies income of the U.S. Grocery segment.&#160; Also in the second quarter of 2005, the
Company recorded a pre-tax gain of $1 million from the sale of its U.S. yogurt
business.&#160; This gain is included in the
operating companies income of the U.S. Cheese, Canada&nbsp;&amp; North America
Foodservice segment.&#160; During the first
quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts business and recorded a
pre-tax gain of $115 million.&#160; This gain
is included in the operating companies income of the Europe, Middle East&nbsp;&amp;
Africa segment.&#160; In addition, in the
first quarter of 2005, the Company sold a minor trademark in Mexico, resulting
in a pre-tax gain of $1 million.&#160; This
gain is included in the operating companies income of the Latin America&nbsp;&amp;
Asia Pacific segment.&#160; During the third
quarter of 2004, the Company sold a Brazilian snack nuts business and recorded
a pre-tax loss of $8 million.&#160; This loss
is included in the operating companies income of the Latin America&nbsp;&amp;
Asia Pacific segment.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues by consumer
sector, which include the separation of Canada and North America Foodservice
into sector components, were as follows (in millions):</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7,718</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
10.&#160; Financial Instruments:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the nine months
and three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, ineffectiveness
related to cash flow hedges was not material.&#160;
At September&nbsp;30, 2005, the Company was hedging forecasted
transactions for periods not exceeding the next fifteen months and expects
substantially all amounts reported in accumulated other comprehensive </font><font face="Times New Roman">earnings
(losses) to be reclassified to the consolidated statement of earnings within
the next twelve months.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hedging
activities affected accumulated other comprehensive earnings (losses), net of
income taxes, as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
11.&#160; Benefit Plans:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company sponsors
noncontributory defined benefit pension plans covering substantially all U.S.
employees.&#160; Pension coverage for
employees of the Company&#146;s non-U.S. subsidiaries is provided, to the extent
deemed appropriate, through separate plans, many of which are governed by local
statutory requirements.&#160; In addition, the
Company&#146;s U.S. and Canadian subsidiaries provide health care and other benefits
to substantially all retired employees.&#160;
Health care benefits for retirees outside the United States and Canada
are generally covered through local government plans.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pension Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Components of Net Periodic
Benefit Cost</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net periodic pension cost
consisted of the following for the nine months and three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004:</font></p>

expense for the nine months, is due primarily to additional pension benefits
related to workforce reduction programs under the Company&#146;s restructuring
program and is included as part of asset impairment and exit costs.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employer
Contributions</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company presently
makes, and plans to make, contributions, to the extent that they do not
generate an excise tax liability, in order to maintain plan assets in excess of
the accumulated benefit obligation of its funded U.S. and non-U.S. plans.&#160; During the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, approximately $210 million and approximately $60 million of employer
contributions were made to U.S. plans and non-U.S. plans, respectively.&#160; Currently, the Company anticipates making
additional contributions of approximately $10 million during the remainder of
2005 to its U.S. plans and approximately $30 million during the remainder of
2005 to its non-U.S. plans, based on current tax law.&#160; However, these estimates are subject to
change as a result of many factors, including changes in tax and other benefit
laws, as well as asset performance significantly above or below the assumed
long-term rate of return on pension assets, or significant changes in interest
rates.&#160; During 2004, employer
contributions of $299 million and $254 million were made to U.S. plans and
non-U.S. plans, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 align="left" style="font-weight:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-decoration:underline;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;text-decoration:none;">Postretirement Benefit Plans</font></i></h1>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net postretirement health
care costs consisted of the following for the nine months and three months
ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.88%;">

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
December&nbsp;2003, the United States enacted into law the Medicare
Prescription Drug, Improvement and Modernization Act of 2003 (the &#147;Act&#148;).&#160; The Act establishes a prescription drug
benefit under Medicare, known as &#147;Medicare Part&nbsp;D,&#148; and a federal subsidy
to sponsors of retiree health care benefit plans that provide a benefit that is
at least actuarially equivalent to Medicare Part&nbsp;D.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
May&nbsp;2004, the FASB issued FASB Staff Position No.&nbsp;106-2, &#147;Accounting
and Disclosure Requirements Related to the Medicare Prescription Drug,
Improvement and Modernization Act of 2003&#148; (&#147;FSP 106-2&#148;).&#160; FSP 106-2 requires companies to account for
the effect of the subsidy on benefits attributable to past service as an
actuarial experience gain and as a reduction of the service cost component of
net postretirement health care costs for amounts attributable to current
service, if the benefit provided is at least actuarially equivalent to Medicare
Part&nbsp;D.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='25',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company adopted FSP 106-2 in the third quarter of 2004.&#160; The impact for the nine months and three months
ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, was a reduction of pre-tax net
postretirement health care costs and an increase in net earnings.&#160; The amounts in the table above reflect the
following benefits:</font></p>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="41%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:41.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Service cost</font></p>
  </td>
