<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
12.&#160; Credit Lines:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April&nbsp;2005, the
Company terminated its $2.0 billion, multi-year revolving credit facility
expiring in July&nbsp;2006 and its $2.5 billion, 364-day revolving credit
facility expiring in July&nbsp;2005 and replaced them with a new $4.5 billion,
multi-year revolving credit facility that expires in April&nbsp;2010.&#160; The Company&#146;s new $4.5 billion, multi-year
revolving credit facility expiring in April&nbsp;2010, which is for its sole
use, requires the maintenance of a minimum net worth of $20.0 billion, up from
$18.2 billion required in each of the previous facilities.&#160; At September&nbsp;30, 2005, the Company&#146;s net
worth was $29.8 billion.&#160; The foregoing
revolving credit facility does not include any other financial tests, any
credit rating triggers or any provisions that could require the posting of
collateral.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
13.&#160; Income Taxes:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company accounts for income taxes in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;109, &#147;Accounting
for Income Taxes.&#148;&#160; The U.S. accounts of
the Company are included in the consolidated federal income tax return of
Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; Income taxes are
generally computed on a separate company basis.&#160;
To the extent that foreign tax credits, capital losses and other credits
generated by the Company, which cannot currently be utilized on a separate
company basis, are utilized in Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal
income tax return, the benefit is recognized in the calculation of the Company&#146;s
provision for income taxes.&#160; The Company
makes payments to, or is reimbursed by, Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. for the tax
effects resulting from its inclusion in Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.&#146;s consolidated
federal income tax return.&#160; Significant
judgment is required in determining income tax provisions and in evaluating tax
positions.&#160; The Company establishes
additional provisions for income taxes when, despite the belief that their tax
positions are fully supportable, there remain certain positions that are likely
to be challenged and that may not be sustained on review by tax
authorities.&#160; Upon the closure of current
and future tax audits in various jurisdictions, significant income tax accrual
reversals could occur.&#160; The Company
evaluates and potentially adjusts these provisions in light of changing facts
and circumstances.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October&nbsp;2004, the
American Jobs Creation Act (&#147;the Jobs Act&#148;) was signed into law.&#160; The Jobs Act includes a deduction for 85% of
certain foreign earnings that are repatriated.&#160;
At the end of June&nbsp;2005, the Company finalized its plan to
repatriate approximately $500 million of earnings under the provisions of the
Jobs Act.&#160; Deferred taxes had previously
been provided for a portion of the dividends to be remitted.&#160; The reversal of the</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='26',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
(continued)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">deferred taxes more than
offset the tax costs to repatriate the earnings and resulted in a net tax
reduction of $19 million in the consolidated income tax provision during the
second quarter of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Jobs Act also
provides tax relief to U.S. domestic manufacturers by providing a tax deduction
related to a percentage of the lesser of &#147;qualified production activities
income&#148; or taxable income.&#160; The
deduction, which is 3% in 2005, increases to 9% by 2010.&#160; In accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;109, the
Company will recognize these benefits in the year earned.&#160; The full year tax benefit in 2005 is expected
to be approximately $25 million.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:6.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><a name="Item2__202723"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 2.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="93%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:93.42%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:6.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="93%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:93.42%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Description
of the Company</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. (&#147;Kraft&#148;), together with its subsidiaries
(collectively referred to as the &#147;Company&#148;), manufactures and markets packaged
food products, consisting principally of beverages, cheese, snacks, convenient
meals and various packaged grocery products.&#160;
Kraft manages and reports operating results through two units, Kraft
North America Commercial and Kraft International Commercial.&#160; Reportable segments for Kraft North America
Commercial are organized and managed principally by product category.&#160; Kraft International Commercial&#146;s operations
are organized and managed by geographic location.&#160; At September&nbsp;30, 2005, Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.
held 98.2% of the combined voting power of Kraft&#146;s outstanding capital stock
and owned 86.5% of the outstanding shares of Kraft&#146;s capital stock.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
June&nbsp;2005, the Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery
business for approximately $1.4 billion.&#160;
The Company has reflected the results of its sugar confectionery
business prior to the closing date as discontinued operations on the condensed
consolidated statements of earnings.&#160;
Accordingly, historical statements of earnings amounts included in
Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
Operations have been restated to reflect the discontinued operation.&#160; The assets related to the sugar confectionery
business were reflected as assets of discontinued operations held for sale on
the consolidated balance sheet at December&nbsp;31, 2004.&#160; The Company recorded a loss on sale of
discontinued operations of $297 million in the second quarter of 2005, related
largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the fourth quarter
of 2004, following the announcement of the sale of its sugar confectionery
business, the Company realigned its North American segments.&#160; Kraft North America Commercial&#146;s new segments
are U.S. Beverages; U.S. Cheese, Canada&nbsp;&amp; North America Foodservice;
U.S. Convenient Meals; U.S. Grocery; and U.S. Snacks&nbsp;&amp; Cereals.&#160; Kraft International Commercial&#146;s segments are
Europe, Middle East&nbsp;&amp; Africa; and Latin America&nbsp;&amp; Asia
Pacific.&#160; The new segment structure in
North America reflects a shift of certain divisions and brands between segments
to more closely align these businesses to consumer sectors, to provide more
focus on the separate beverage and grocery businesses, and to benefit from
synergies in grain based products.&#160;
Historical data have been restated to reflect the new segment
structure.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, in October&nbsp;2005,
the Company announced that, effective January&nbsp;1, 2006, its Canadian
business will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North
American business by product category.&#160;
Accordingly, in 2006 its operations will be reported throughout the
North American food segments and prior period segment amounts will be restated.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As previously stated, for
significant business reasons, the Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. Board of Directors is
looking at a number of restructuring alternatives, including the possibility of
separating Kraft from the balance of Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; Altria Group,&nbsp;Inc. has indicated that
continuing improvements in its litigation environment are a prerequisite to
such action by its Board of Directors, and the timing and chronology of events
are uncertain.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Executive
Summary</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following executive summary is intended to provide significant
highlights of the Discussion and Analysis that follows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Operating Results for the Nine Months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005</font></i>
<font face="Symbol">-</font>
The changes in the Company&#146;s earnings and diluted earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;)
from continuing operations for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005,
from the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, were due primarily to the
following (in millions, except per share data):</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.02%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operations</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(168</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.10</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.02%;">

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">

  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,131</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.26</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">See discussion of events affecting the
comparability of statement of earnings amounts in the Consolidated Operating
Results section&nbsp;of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
favorable net impact of lower asset impairment, exit and implementation costs
on earnings and diluted EPS from continuing operations is due primarily to the
following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Program</font></i> &#150; In January&nbsp;2004, the Company
announced a three-year restructuring program.&#160;
As part of this program, the Company anticipates the closing or sale of
up to 20 plants and the elimination of approximately 6,000 positions.&#160; From 2004 to 2006, the Company expects to
incur approximately $1.2 billion in pre-tax charges, reflecting asset
disposals, severance and other implementation costs.&#160; During the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004, the Company recorded pre-tax charges of $173 million ($115
million after-tax) and $469 million ($308 million after-tax), respectively, for
the restructuring program, including pre-tax implementation costs of $61
million and $17 million, respectively.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Asset Impairment Charges</font></i> &#150; During the first quarter of 2005, the Company incurred a
pre-tax asset impairment charge of $93 million ($62 million after-tax) in
recognition of the sale of its fruit snacks business, which closed in the
second quarter of 2005.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For further details on the restructuring program and
asset impairment charges, see Note 2 to the Condensed Consolidated Financial
Statements and the Business Environment section&nbsp;of the following
Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gains on Sales of Businesses</font></i> &#150; The favorable impact on earnings and diluted EPS from continuing
operations is due primarily to the gain on sale of the U.K. desserts
business in the first quarter of 2005.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Lower
Income Tax Rate</font></i> &#150; The
Company&#146;s reported income tax rate decreased by 1.4 percentage points to
30.4%.&#160; The 2005 tax rate reflects the
settlement of an outstanding U.S. tax claim and the resolution of outstanding
items in the Company&#146;s international operations, as well as other benefits,
including the impact of </p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">both the domestic
manufacturers&#146; deduction provision and the dividend repatriation provision of
the American Jobs Creation Act.&#160; The 2004
tax rate reflects a $76 million favorable resolution of an outstanding tax item
in the third quarter of 2004 and the reversal of tax accruals that were no
longer required due to tax events that occurred during the first quarter of
2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Currency</font></i> &#150;
The favorable currency impact on earnings and diluted EPS from continuing
operations is due primarily to the weakness of the U.S. dollar versus the euro,
the Canadian dollar and certain other currencies.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operations</font></i> &#150;
The decrease in results from operations was due primarily to the following:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower
income at Kraft North America Commercial, reflecting higher commodity and
benefit costs, and increased marketing spending, partially offset by higher
volume/mix and pricing.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower
income at Kraft International Commercial, reflecting higher commodity costs,
partially offset by favorable volume/mix and higher pricing.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For
further details, see the Consolidated Operating Results and Operating Results
by Business Segment sections of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Operating Results for the Three Months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005</font></i>
<font face="Symbol">-</font>
The changes in the Company&#146;s earnings and diluted EPS from continuing
operations for the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, from the three
months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, were due primarily to the following (in
millions, except per share data):</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Higher income
  tax rate</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(52</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.03</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Shares
  outstanding</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">See discussion of events affecting the
comparability of statement of earnings amounts in the Consolidated Operating
Results section&nbsp;of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
favorable net impact of lower asset impairment, exit and implementation costs
on earnings and diluted EPS from continuing operations is due primarily to the
following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Program</font></i> &#150; During the three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004, the Company recorded pre-tax charges of $42 million ($28 million
after-tax) and $51 million ($33 million after-tax), respectively, for the
restructuring program, including pre-tax implementation costs of $16 million
and $7 million, respectively.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For further details on the restructuring program, see
Note 2 to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements and the Business
Environment section&nbsp;of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Higher
Income Tax Rate</font></i> &#150; The
Company&#146;s reported income tax rate increased by 4.8 percentage points to
33.1%.&#160; The 2004 tax rate reflects a $76
million favorable resolution of an outstanding tax item.&#160; Lower repatriation costs in 2005 partially
offset this prior year benefit.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Currency</font></i> &#150;
The favorable currency impact on earnings and diluted EPS from continuing
operations is due primarily to the weakness of the U.S. dollar versus the
Canadian dollar and Latin American currencies.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operations</font></i> &#150;
The decrease in results from operations was due primarily to the following:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower
income at Kraft North America Commercial, reflecting higher commodity and
benefit costs, and increased marketing spending, partially offset by higher
volume/mix and higher pricing.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For
further details, see the Consolidated Operating Results and Operating Results
by Business Segment sections of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">2005 Forecasted Results</font></i> &#150; In October&nbsp;2005, as a result of
higher than anticipated commodity costs for the year, the Company reduced its
forecasted 2005 full-year diluted EPS on a continuing operations basis to $1.68
to $1.71 from $1.73 to $1.78.&#160; This
guidance includes anticipated charges of $0.22 for costs related to the
restructuring program and impairment charges, and $0.04 in gains on sales of
businesses.&#160; The guidance excludes the
possible impacts of any potential divestiture.&#160;
The Company projects commodity costs will increase by approximately $800
million in 2005 versus the prior year, which is approximately $200 million
higher than previous projections.&#160; The
key drivers of the increase are higher than expected energy, packaging and dairy
costs.&#160; The Company&#146;s full-year and
fourth quarter 2005 results will contain an additional shipping week, which
represents a positive earnings impact of approximately $0.04 per share.&#160; The Company also expects a full-year tax rate
of approximately 31%.&#160; The factors
described in the section&nbsp;entitled <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Forward-Looking
and Cautionary Statements</font></i> of the following Discussion and Analysis
represent continuing risks to these forecasts.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Discussion and Analysis</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Business Environment</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company is subject to a number of challenges that may adversely affect its
businesses.&#160; These challenges, which are
discussed below and under &#147;</font>Forward-Looking and Cautionary Statements</font>,&#148; include:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>fluctuations
in commodity prices;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>movements
of foreign currencies;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>competitive
challenges in various products and markets, including price gaps with
competitor products and the increasing price-consciousness of consumers;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
rising cost environment and the ability to increase prices;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
trend toward increasing consolidation in the retail trade and consequent
pricing pressure and inventory reductions;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
growing presence of hard discount retailers, primarily in Europe, with an
emphasis on own-label products;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>changing
consumer preferences, including diet trends;</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>competitors
with different profit objectives and less susceptibility to currency exchange
rates; and</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>concerns
and/or regulations regarding food safety, quality and health, including
genetically modified organisms, trans-fatty acids and obesity.&#160; Increased government regulation of the food
industry could result in increased costs to the Company.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the ordinary course of
business, the Company is subject to many influences that can impact the timing
of sales to customers, including the timing of holidays and other annual or
special events, seasonality of certain products, significant weather
conditions, timing of Company and customer incentive programs and pricing
actions, customer inventory programs, Company initiatives to improve supply
chain efficiency, including efforts to align product shipments more closely
with consumption by shifting some of its customer marketing programs to a
consumption based approach, the financial condition of customers and general economic
conditions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">2005 Operating Environment:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Commodity costs continued to
rise for the Company, with significant impacts resulting from higher coffee,
nuts, energy and packaging costs, partially offset by lower year-over-year
dairy costs.&#160; However, the favorability
from declining dairy costs was not as much as the Company expected.&#160; Third quarter commodity costs were up
approximately $200 million versus the prior year.&#160; Year-to-date, aggregate commodity costs have
risen approximately $600 million versus the prior year.&#160; Full-year 2005 commodity costs are projected
to increase by approximately $800 million versus 2004, which is approximately
$200 million higher than previous projections.&#160;
Key drivers of the increase in projections are higher than expected
energy, packaging and dairy costs.&#160; The
Company expects the higher cost environment to continue, particularly for
energy and packaging.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2004, the
Company announced a three-year restructuring program, with the objectives of
leveraging the Company&#146;s global scale, realigning and lowering its cost
structure, and optimizing capacity utilization.&#160;
As part of this program (which is discussed further in Note 2 to the
condensed consolidated financial statements), the Company anticipates the
closing or sale of up to 20 plants and the elimination of approximately 6,000
positions.&#160; From 2004 through 2006, the
Company expects to incur approximately $1.2 billion in pre-tax charges,
reflecting asset disposals, severance and other implementation costs, including
$173 million and $479 million incurred in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004, respectively, and $42 million and $61 million incurred in the
three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, respectively.&#160; Total pre-tax charges for the program
incurred through September&nbsp;30, 2005 were $814 million.&#160; Approximately one-half of the pre-tax charges
are expected to require cash payments.&#160;
It is possible that the Company may undertake additional restructuring
programs in the future.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the Company
expects to incur approximately $140 million in capital expenditures from 2004
through 2006 to implement the restructuring program, including $69 million
spent in the first nine months of 2005.&#160;
From January&nbsp;2004 through September&nbsp;30, 2005, the Company
spent $115 million in capital to implement the restructuring program.&#160; Cost savings as a result of the restructuring
program were approximately $127 million in 2004, are expected to increase by an
incremental $120 million to $140 million in 2005 (approximately $99 million of
which occurred during the first nine months of 2005), and are anticipated to
reach annualized cost savings of approximately $400 million by 2006, all of
which are expected to be used in supporting brand-building initiatives.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Acquisitions
and Dispositions:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">One element of the
Company&#146;s growth strategy is to strengthen its brand portfolios through a
disciplined program of selective acquisitions and divestitures.&#160; The Company is constantly reviewing potential
acquisition candidates and from time to time sells businesses to accelerate the
shift in its portfolio toward businesses &#150; whether global, regional or local &#150;
that offer the Company a sustainable competitive advantage.&#160; The impact of any future acquisition or
divestiture could have a material impact on the Company&#146;s consolidated
financial position, results of operations or cash flows, and future sales of
businesses could in some cases result in losses on sale.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As previously discussed,
the Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business in June&nbsp;2005
for approximately $1.4 billion.&#160; The sale
included the <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Life Savers</font></i>, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Creme Savers</font></i>,
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Altoids</font></i>, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Trolli</font></i>
and <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Sugus</font></i> brands.&#160; The Company has reflected the results of its
sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as discontinued
operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings.&#160; The assets related to the sugar confectionery
business were reflected as assets of discontinued operations held for sale on
the consolidated balance sheet at December&nbsp;31, 2004.&#160; The Company recorded a loss on sale of
discontinued operations of $297 million in the second quarter of 2005, related
largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the second quarter of 2005, the Company also sold its fruit snacks business
resulting in a pre-tax loss of $2 million.&#160;
The Company incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $93 million in
the first quarter of 2005, in recognition of the sale of this business.&#160; During the first quarter of 2005, the Company
sold its U.K. desserts business, its U.S. yogurt business and a minor trademark
in Mexico.&#160; During the third quarter of
2004, the Company sold a Brazilian snack nuts business.&#160; The aggregate proceeds received from the sales
of these businesses, excluding the sale of the sugar confectionery business,
during the first nine months of 2005 and 2004 were $218 million and $11
million, respectively.&#160; The Company
recorded pre-tax gains from sales of these other businesses of $115 million
during the first nine months of 2005</font>, and recorded pre-tax losses from
sales of these other businesses of $8 million during the first nine months of
2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The operating results of
businesses acquired and sold, excluding the sugar confectionery businesses,
were not material to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
operations or cash flows in any of the periods presented.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other:</font></i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2004, the Company had
operations and plants or sold product to third-party distributors located in 14
Middle East countries (as defined by the U.S. Department of State, Bureau of
Near Eastern Affairs), including a biscuit business acquired during 2003 in
Egypt.&#160; In the region, the Company had
operations and plants in three countries (Egypt, Morocco and through a majority
owned joint venture, Saudi Arabia).&#160; In
addition, the Company sold products to third-party distributors located in 11
of these countries (Algeria, Bahrain, Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Oman, Qatar,
Tunisia, United Arab Emirates and Yemen).&#160;
Revenue generated from operations or sales to the third-party
distributors in the Middle East was approximately $250 million in 2004,
representing 3.3% of the net revenues of the Europe, Middle East and Africa
segment.&#160; In addition, in 2004, the Company
entered into agreements with third-parties for the resale of the Company&#146;s
products into Iraq, Libya and Syria.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

  </td>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following events occurred during the first nine months and third quarter of
2005 and 2004 that affected the comparability of statement of earnings amounts:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Asset impairment, exit and
implementation costs </font></i>&#150; As discussed
in Note 2 to the condensed consolidated financial statements, during the nine
months and three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, the Company recorded
asset impairment and exit costs of $205 million and $26 million, respectively,
on its condensed consolidated statements of earnings.&#160; During the nine months and three months ended
September&nbsp;30, 2004, the Company recorded asset impairment and exit costs
on continuing operations of $464 million and $44 million, respectively, on its
condensed consolidated statements of earnings.&#160;
Additionally, during the nine months and three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, the Company also recorded $61 million and $16 million, respectively, of
pre-tax implementation costs.&#160; During the
nine months and three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004, the Company
recorded on continuing operations $17 million and $7 million, respectively, of
pre-tax implementation costs.&#160; The pre-tax
asset impairment, exit and implementation costs were included in the operating
companies income of the following segments:</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Gains/Losses on Sales of Businesses </font></i>&#150; During the second quarter of 2005, the Company sold
its fruit snacks business and recorded a pre-tax loss of $2 million.&#160; This loss is included in the operating
companies income of the U.S. Grocery segment.&#160;
Also in the second quarter of 2005, the Company recorded a pre-tax gain
of $1 million from the sale of its U.S. yogurt business.&#160; This gain is included in the operating
companies income of the U.S. Cheese, Canada&nbsp;&amp; North America
Foodservice segment.&#160; During the first
quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts business and recorded a
pre-tax gain of $115 million.&#160; This gain
is included in the operating companies income of the Europe, Middle East&nbsp;&amp;
Africa segment.&#160; In addition, in the
first quarter of 2005, the Company sold a minor trademark in Mexico, resulting
in a pre-tax gain of $1 million.&#160; This
gain is included in the operating companies income of the Latin America&nbsp;&amp;
Asia Pacific segment.&#160; During the
third quarter of 2004, the Company sold a Brazilian snack nuts business and
recorded a pre-tax loss of $8 million.&#160;
This loss is included in the operating companies income of the Latin
America&nbsp;&amp; Asia Pacific segment.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Discontinued Operations </font></i>&#150; As more fully discussed in Note 5. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Divestitures</font></i>, in June&nbsp;2005, the Company sold
substantially all of its sugar confectionery business.&#160; The Company has reflected the results of its
sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as discontinued
operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings.&#160; The Company recorded a loss on sale of
discontinued operations of $297 million in the second quarter of 2005, related
largely to taxes on the transaction.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As
discussed in Note 9. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Segment Reporting</font></i>,
the Company&#146;s management uses operating companies income, which is defined as
operating income before general corporate expenses and amortization of
intangibles, to evaluate segment performance and allocate resources.&#160; Management believes it is appropriate to
disclose this measure to help investors analyze the business performance and
trends of the various business segments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Results of Operations for the Nine Months Ended September&nbsp;30, 2005</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following discussion
compares consolidated operating results for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, with the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Volume decreased
slightly, due primarily to the impact of higher retail prices on category
growth trends in the United States, declines in certain international countries
(most notably Germany) and the impact of divestitures, partially offset by the
2004 acquisition of Veryfine Products,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Veryfine&#148;), new product
introductions and growth in developing markets.&#160;
Excluding all acquisitions and divestitures, volume decreased 0.3%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues increased
$1,066 million (4.6%), due primarily to favorable currency ($467 million),
favorable volume/mix ($386 million), higher net pricing ($279 million,
reflecting commodity-driven pricing, partially offset by increased promotional
spending) and the impact of acquisitions ($42 million), partially offset by the
impact of divested businesses ($112 million).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating income
increased $141 million (4.1%)</font>, due primarily to lower pre-tax charges for asset impairment and exit
costs ($259 million), favorable volume/mix ($172 million), net gains on the
sale of businesses ($123 million) and favorable currency ($72 million), partially
offset by higher marketing, administration and research costs ($256 million,
including higher benefit and marketing costs), unfavorable costs, net of higher
pricing ($135 million, due primarily to higher commodity costs and increased
promotional spending), the net impact of higher implementation costs associated
with the restructuring program ($44 million), higher fixed manufacturing costs
($19 million) and the impact of divestitures ($18 million).</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Currency movements
increased net revenues by $467 million and operating income by $72
million.&#160; These increases were due
primarily to the weakness of the U.S. dollar against the euro, the Canadian
dollar and certain other currencies.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s reported
income tax rate decreased by 1.4 percentage points to 30.4%, due primarily to
the settlement of an outstanding U.S. tax claim and the resolution of
outstanding items in the Company&#146;s international operations, as well as other
benefits, including the impact of both the domestic manufacturers&#146; deduction provision
and the dividend repatriation provision of the American Jobs Creation Act.&#160; The 2004 tax rate reflects a $76 million
favorable resolution of an outstanding tax item in the third quarter of 2004
and the reversal of tax accruals that were no longer required due to tax events
that occurred during the first quarter of 2004.&#160;
Upon the closure of current and
future tax audits in various jurisdictions, significant income tax accrual
reversals could occur.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Earnings from continuing
operations of $2,131 million increased $139 million (7.0%), due primarily to
higher operating income and a lower income tax rate.&#160; Diluted EPS from continuing operations, which
was $1.26, increased by 8.6%.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\cmuller\05-18510-1\task649295\18510-1-ba-03.htm',USER='cmuller',CD='Nov  8 14:01 2005' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Loss) earnings from
discontinued operations, net of income taxes, decreased $317 million, due
primarily to a loss on sale of $297 million in 2005.&#160; The loss from discontinued operations was due
primarily to the recording of additional tax expense that arose from the sale
of the sugar confectionery business in the second quarter of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net earnings of $1,859
million decreased $178 million (8.7%).&#160;
Diluted EPS from net earnings, which was $1.10, decreased by 7.6%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Results of Operations for the Three Months Ended September&nbsp;30, 2005</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following discussion
compares consolidated operating results for the three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, with the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Volume increased 0.3%,
due primarily to higher U.S. ready-to-drink beverage shipments and growth in
Latin America, partially offset by declines in certain international countries
(most notably Germany) and the impact of divestitures.&#160; Excluding divestitures, volume increased
1.3%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues increased
$339 million (4.4%), due primarily to higher volume/mix ($205 million),
favorable currency ($118 million) and higher net pricing ($70 million,
reflecting commodity-driven pricing, partially offset by increased promotional
spending), partially offset by the impact of divested businesses ($58 million).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating income
decreased $84 million (6.8%)</font>,
due primarily to unfavorable costs, net of higher pricing ($99 million, due
primarily to higher commodity costs and increased promotional spending), higher
marketing, administration and research costs ($86 million, including higher
benefit and marketing costs), higher fixed manufacturing costs ($15 million),
the net impact of higher implementation costs associated with the restructuring
program ($9 million) and the impact of divestitures ($7 million), partially
offset by higher volume/mix ($85 million), favorable currency ($27 million),
lower pre-tax charges for asset impairment and exit costs ($18 million) and the
2004 loss on the sale of a business ($8 million).</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Currency movements increased
net revenues by $118 million and operating income by $27 million.&#160; These increases were due primarily to the
weakness of the U.S. dollar against the Canadian dollar and Latin American
currencies.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s reported
income tax rate increased by 4.8 percentage points to 33.1%, due primarily to a
$76 million favorable resolution of an outstanding tax item in the third
quarter of 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Earnings from continuing
operations of $674 million decreased $92 million (12.0%), due primarily to
lower operating income and a higher income tax rate.&#160; Diluted EPS from continuing operations, which
was $0.40, decreased by 11.1%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net earnings of $674
million decreased $105 million (13.5%).&#160;
Diluted EPS from net earnings, which was $0.40, decreased by 13.0%.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Operating
Results by Business Segment</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Kraft
North America Commercial</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Operating
Results</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following discussion
compares Kraft North America Commercial&#146;s operating results for the nine months
ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 with the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="80%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:80.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.32%;">

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:19.62%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.32%;">

  <td width="54%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:54.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating companies income</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
